body: Feel free to send a PR, low priority
@alexander-akait to avoid going down the wrong path, do you have pointers where should we check the filename length? Happy to work on a PR!
How you get this long path?

The config is from an upcoming webpack5 rewrite of the NativeScript build setup - we're building the config dynamically using webpack-chain, and here's a rough output of the config that causes the ENAMETOOLONG issue when doing hmr:

https://gist.github.com/rigor789/838c5ae02139c3e26aeb638493021611

In this particular case - disabling the "bundle" loader stack: https://gist.github.com/rigor789/838c5ae02139c3e26aeb638493021611#file-webpack-config-js-L55-L70 works fine - however that just masks the underlying issue (and we do need that loader in place to inject our hmr runtime code).

The `ruleSet_1_rules_8_use_0` etc parts in the filename - I'm not sure if these are added by webpack of perhaps vue-loader (it does some rule cloning internally & adds resourceQueries, it could be related to that maybe)?

Update: I managed to reproduce it in an isolated project, and it seems to be related to worker chunks.

Included steps to reproduce in the README:

https://github.com/rigor789/webpack-hmr-enametoolong (Note: i'm running it on macOS - may behave differently on other OSes)
~~I am afraid it is not easy to fix, even more I think it is not fixable~~ I was wrong, not hard to fix
@alexander-akait Thanks for looking into it - got me worried for a second there! ðŸ˜† If you can point me in the right direction, I'm happy to work on the fix!
https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/master/lib/HotModuleReplacementPlugin.js, but looks it require more code

I traced back where the `runtime` name is generated: 
https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/e643b85a6accde7e4c7f19c8770816e5aaf6a945/lib/dependencies/WorkerPlugin.js#L266-L270

Would it be safe to do a length check & truncate very long names (with a hash) like this: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/e643b85a6accde7e4c7f19c8770816e5aaf6a945/lib/optimize/SplitChunksPlugin.js#L1634-L1639


*(seems to be fine, just not sure if it would affect anything else)*
As workaround you can manually give the worker chunk a name with `/* webpackChunkName: "name" */` in the `new Worker(..)` call.

Thanks @sokra, I have found your comment about that in https://github.com/webpack/webpack/pull/11439#issuecomment-688693800 and have tried naming the chunk. It is renamed, however a HMR chunk/update still crashes. Patching the WorkerPlugin & truncating the `entryOptions.runtime` seemed to solve the crash (and everything else appears to be fine), but I don't feel confident it's the right fix.

issue.title: [webpack5] Name too long

repository.name: NativeScript
repository.description: âš¡ Empowering JavaScript with native platform APIs. âœ¨ Best of all worlds (TypeScript, Swift, Objective C, Kotlin, Java, Dart). Use what you love â¤ï¸ Angular, React, Solid, Svelte, Vue with: iOS (UIKit, SwiftUI), Android (View, Jetpack Compose), Flutter and you name it compatible.

issue.body:
Hi,

I'm getting this bug on hotdeploy:

``` 
Error: ENAMETOOLONG: name too long, open '/ns-app/loja/platforms/android/app/src/main/assets/app/_node_modules_nativescript_webpack_node_modules_babel-loader_lib_index_js_clonedRuleSet-3_0_rules_0_use_0_node_modules_nativescript_webpack_dist_loaders_nativescript-worker-loader_index_js_app_view-model_produto-view-model_js_59_21-92.0ea48b4beefd1b228048.hot-update.json'
```

Version 

```
root@b6e835f79006:/ns-app# ns doctor
âœ” Getting environment information 

No issues were detected.
âœ” Your ANDROID_HOME environment variable is set and points to correct directory.
âœ” Your adb from the Android SDK is correctly installed.
âœ” The Android SDK is installed.
âœ” A compatible Android SDK for compilation is found.
âœ” Javac is installed and is configured properly.
âœ” The Java Development Kit (JDK) is installed and is configured properly.
âœ” Local builds for iOS can be executed only on a macOS system. To build for iOS on a different operating system, you can use the NativeScript cloud infrastructure.
âœ” Getting NativeScript components versions information...
âœ” Component nativescript has 8.0.1 version and is up to date.
 
```
This is a bug?

Thanks

issue.title: fix problems with auto-generated runtime name for workers

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
Make auto-generated runtime name a hash instead of leaking pathinfo
Make auto-generated runtime name more stable by using index instead of source code location

fixes #12883

issue.title: Build fails with `ENAMETOOLONG: name too long, open` error

labels.name: triage/support
labels.description: Indicates an issue that is a support question.

labels.name: lifecycle/rotten
labels.description: Denotes an issue or PR that has aged beyond stale and will be auto-closed.

labels.name: kind/dependency-change
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to changing dependencies

issue.body:
When I am running build on Ubuntu 21.04 from master branch and getting the error below. I am following Quickstart readme section https://github.com/openshift/console#quickstart.
```
$ ./build.sh
[webpack-cli] [Error: ENAMETOOLONG: name too long, open '/home/denis/p/console/frontend/public/dist/vendors~admin-pipeline~admin-tasks`~admin-triggers~delete-revision~dev-console-add~dev-console-deplo~01c3391d-chunk-542127130c88b772b998.min.js.map'] {
  errno: -36,
  code: 'ENAMETOOLONG',
  syscall: 'open',
  path: '/home/denis/p/console/frontend/public/dist/vendors~admin-pipeline~admin-tasks`~admin-triggers~delete-revision~dev-console-add~dev-console-deplo~01c3391d-chunk-542127130c88b772b998.min.js.map'
}
```
Is there any way around this?
Thanks!
